image.altText: Metro bus

props.synopsis: Tasmania's education department and a bus company have both appeared in court after a child with a disability was allegedly left unattended on a bus with access to a bottle of engine coolant in a plastic water bottle.

title.children: Education department and bus company charged over child's access to engine coolant

image.altText: He stands beneath a tree by a river. The photo is close-up on his face.

props.synopsis: Medical experts fear sick or injured Tasmanians who make their own way to emergency departments wait longer than others, due to pressures to fast-track ambulance patients.

title.children: 'Moral distress': Nurses, doctors groups warn policy puts ambulance patients ahead of drop-ins

image.altText: A digital rendering of the inside of a stadium with an AFL match underway.

props.synopsis: An expert planning panel has defended their scathing assessment of Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium while speaking to the politicians who will ultimately decide the project's fate.

title.children: Economic case for Hobart stadium just doesn't add up, experts say

image.altText: Stolen truck chase

props.synopsis: During sentencing, a Supreme Court Justice told Patrick Lee Brown he "completely disregarded the safety of anyone else" during two different police pursuits, including one in a stolen rental truck with blown-out tyres.

title.children: Driver high on meth who led police on chase with rental truck jailed

image.altText: A man in hi vis stands in front of a stack of timber

props.synopsis: The government has struck a deal with the Greens to overhaul Australia environmental laws, sparking concerns for the future of Tasmania's native logging industry.

title.children: Sawmiller 'worried' as Labor, Greens strike deal over environment laws

image.altText: Six raw salmon fillets on a chopping board beside a bowl of pistachio bread crumbs and honey marindade.

props.synopsis: Despite being a big earner for the state, there are increasing concerns about the environmental and animal welfare impacts of our salmon industry. Airlie Ward talks with reporter Sophie Jaggers.

title.children: TassieCast: Will Tasmanian salmon be on your table this Christmas?

image.altText: Two people wrapped in blankets watching the fires at Wang Fuk Court.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades tore through a group of high-rise residential towers in a densely packed housing estate, causing major issues for firefighters. This is how the catastrophe unfolded.

title.children: With each passing hour, a major Hong Kong fire only became more deadly

image.altText: People look towards a burnt buildings in Hong Kong.

props.synopsis: Just months ago, Hong Kong leaders were dismissing calls for a total ban on bamboo scaffolding on construction sites. Now they are facing one of the region's worst building-fire catastrophes, and anger is growing.

title.children: Hong Kong fire prompts anger, questions about construction safety

image.altText: Australian mortgages

props.synopsis: Australians' love affair with credit is showing no signs of slowing, with private sector credit growth rising 0.7 per cent in October, according to RBA data. The ASX is trading flat.

title.children: Investor loans outpacing owner-occupier credit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Federal Reserve hot seat up for grabs

image.altText: A split-screen image of a man and a woman, both wearing National Guard uniforms.

props.synopsis: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died in hospital after an ambush shooting near the White House on Wednesday. A male soldier who was also shot, Andrew Wolfe, is fighting for his life, the president says.

title.children: Donald Trump says National Guard soldier shot in Washington DC has died

image.altText: A white sign on a building reading "Monash IVF"

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

title.children: Major IVF provider hit with restrictions after embryo bungle

image.altText: A group of formally dressed people smile and hold trophies in celebration in a group portrait on the edge of a stage.

props.synopsis: The pair's investigation had an immediate impact on Australia's childcare industry, resulting in the suspension of one centre and a raft of government policy changes and safety reforms.

title.children: ABC's Adele Ferguson, Chris Gillett win Gold Walkley for childcare investigation

image.altText: Benedict Bryant leaving

props.synopsis: Benedict Bryant had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death over the crash in inner Sydney in February 2022, which killed Jai Wright.

title.children: 'This should be the outcome': Officer guilty over fatal police pursuit crash

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in science lab.

props.synopsis: An 86-year-old farmer claims this year's Dairy Science Award for inventing spreadable butter by mixing oils with cultured cream, during a time when it was illegal.

title.children: Dairy 'disrupter' who invented spreadable butter in 70s wins science award

image.altText: Soldiers standing on the side of a building with two other men near a broken garage door on the ground

props.synopsis: Video has emerged appearing to show two Palestinians being 'executed' by Israeli forces in the West Bank, with the Israeli military saying it has launched an investigation into the incident.

title.children: Video appears to show Israeli soldiers 'executing' two Palestinians in West Bank

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for kids under 16 approaches, popular messaging app Snapchat says young people will be able to verify their age by sending a selfie or their ID to a third-party platform, but sharing sensitive data carries risks.

title.children: Cybersecurity experts alarmed by Snapchat's age-verification plan

image.altText: Two people sit talking in an outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

title.children: After 38 years, Jane Edmanson is hanging up her Gardening Australia gloves

image.altText: Breanna Koenen and Jasmine Garner hold the premiership cup

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of the 2025 AFLW grand final

image.altText: Environment Minister Murray Watt walks in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

title.children: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial deal

image.altText: Broken down on the Birdsville Track

props.synopsis: The ABC's Landline crew discovers extreme kindness with a can-do attitude after a mechanical breakdown in South Australia's outback.

title.children: Broken down on the Birdsville Track in search of a cattle-carrying boat

image.altText: Building materials tested for asbestos.

props.synopsis: An anti-asbestos advocate wants a review of import supply chains after a third renewable energy company confirmed the discovery of asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts.

title.children: Third renewable energy company discovers asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts

image.altText: Man in glasses side on.

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli has responded to the findings of a corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson.

title.children: Ex-Townsville mayor's campaign lies prompt review of local government laws

image.altText: Picture of lit up dome and theme park

props.synopsis: A mega theme park and entertainment precinct has been proposed for a rural township between Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast. But will this one happen?

title.children: Will this $2.6b theme park succeed where others have failed?

image.altText: Police officers standing in the backyard of a house.

props.synopsis: Wayne Pedro Morseu was reported missing on November 10, with police now upgrading his disappearance to suspicious.

title.children: Crime scenes declared in North Qld over man's suspicious disappearance

image.altText: A police car is outside the entrance of an old prison where a French flag is flying and half a dozen officers are standing.

props.synopsis: The fugitives broke out of the prison in the eastern city of Dijon in the early hours of Thrusday, local time, and 100 police officers are on their trail.

title.children: French prisoners escape jail using saw and bedsheets

image.altText: An image of a man clad in black throwing an object.

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assaulting police at a rally in Melbourne's CBD in October. The arrests come as police prepare for another demonstration in the city on Sunday.

title.children: More arrests over protest violence as police prepare for another Melbourne rally

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

title.children: Boatie who went missing twice died from 'exposure to the sea'

image.altText: A red and yellow striped balloon in the air with clouds around it.

props.synopsis: Hot air balloon rides are nearly 10 times riskier than a joy flight in a light plane or a helicopter, a new report by the national transport safety investigator has found.

title.children: Hot air balloon rides nearly 10 times riskier as helicopter or plane

image.altText: Golfer Fuzzy Zoeller looking down the fiarway after hitting a driver

props.synopsis: Fuzzy Zoeller, a two-time major champion and one of golf's most gregarious characters whose career was tainted by a racially insensitive joke about Tiger Woods, has died aged 74.

title.children: Fuzzy Zoeller, who beat Greg Norman to win 1984 US Open playoff, dies

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron speaks into a microphone with several military people behind him.

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron is reintroducing voluntary military service almost three decades after it was scrapped.

title.children: France to reintroduce voluntary military service amid growing threat of war with Russia

image.altText: A woman with long, blonde hair is formally dressed as she sits in front of a large set of shelves.

props.synopsis: Not all Australians aged under 16 will "magically disappear overnight" from social media, the nation's online safety regulator says, amid a legal challenge to pause the start of the federal government's ban.

title.children: Social media ban implementation will 'vary' across platforms, regulator warns

image.altText: A headland view of a beach

props.synopsis: The Swiss consulate says it is providing support for the relatives of two Swiss nationals who were attacked by a bull shark on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Consulate 'supporting the relatives' of Swiss shark attack victims

image.altText: A shopper carrying a bag walks past a shop in Perth's city centre

props.synopsis: As scammers look to exploit sales during Black Friday and Cyber Monday we explain what you need to know to avoid being duped.

title.children: How to spot a scam during Black Friday and Cyber Monday
